column1: A social networking service (also social networking site
column2: SNS or social media) is an online platform that is used by people to build social networks or social relations with other people who share similar personal or career interests
column4: backgrounds or real-life connections. The variety of stand-alone and built-in social networking services available online in the 2010s introduces challenges of definition
column5: but there are some common features: (1) social networking services are Web 2.0 Internet-based applications
column6: (2) user-generated content (UGC) such as text posts
column8: is the lifeblood of SNS organisms
column9: (3) users create service-specific user profiles for the site or "app" that are designed and maintained by the SNS organization
column10: and (4) social networking services facilitate the development of online social networks by connecting a user's profile with those of other individuals and/or groups. Most social network services are web-based and provide means for users to interact over the Internet
column11: such as by e-mail and instant messaging and online forums.
